case_vignette: A 33-year-old man presents to his primary care physician with shoulder pain. He states that he can't remember a specific instance when the injury occurred. He is a weight lifter and competes in martial arts. The patient has no past medical history and is currently taking a multivitamin. Physical exam demonstrates pain with abduction of the patient's right shoulder and with external rotation of the right arm. There is subacromial tenderness with palpation. His left arm demonstrates 10/10 strength with abduction as compared to 4/10 strength with abduction of the right arm.
question: Which  best confirms the underlying diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have shoulder pain and it hurts more when I lift my right arm to the side or rotate it outward.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I can't remember a specific instance when the injury occurred.
Do you have any medical conditions or take any medications that might be relevant to this issue?
No, I don't have any past medical history, and I'm just taking a multivitamin.
Do any of your family members have a history of shoulder problems or joint issues?
I'm sorry, but that information was not provided in our initial discussion.
That's okay. Thank you for letting me know. Based on the information provided, I would like to ask about your age and gender.
